projects.name: Spotitrack
projects.what: A web application this is used to track previous versions of playlists. One could revert a playlist from a previous version.
projects.sowhat: My first project with Django, Postgres, and React. We created a dynamic website that had an intricate backend with an elegant frontend.
projects.nowwhat: These tools are most haves for web development. Using a SQL language, like Postgres, is incredibly useful for a dynamic website.

projects.name: VR Western Shootout
projects.what: Created in the Unity Engine, this is was my first completed video game.
projects.sowhat: This was my first time learning C#. I learned how to work in the Unity Engine with colleagues. We used git for version control with an agile workflow.
projects.nowwhat: I have a love for working in the Unity Engine. I am currently working on another video game!
projects.alt: A gif of the gameplay of VR Western Shootout.

projects.name: Based on Books
projects.what: A web application that returns media that is based off books.
projects.sowhat: I learned how to access and use APIs and Databases. This was also an introduction to Javascript. As much as I hate Javascript, it is a useful tool for static webpages.
projects.nowwhat: With these skills, I am more efficent at creating webpages. These assets have helped me create this webpage!
projects.alt: Based on Books' search bar and filter user interface.

projects.name: Y86 Simulator
projects.what: A systems project, this is used to simulate a Y86 instruction set. Unfortunately, I cannot share this repository.
projects.sowhat: This project gave me an appreciation for C and Assembly. It also gave me a deeper understanding on how computer hardware manipulates data.
projects.nowwhat: Learning a CPU Instruction Set, even if it is a "toy" instruction set, is beneficiary to my career.

projects.name: Solar
projects.what: A static, "dummy" website created by a colleague and I. It does not have any purpose but instruction.
projects.sowhat: I have learned the basics of web development. I learned HTML and CSS, the bread and butter of web development.
projects.nowwhat: I use HTML and CSS almost every project. Obvioulsy this page uses it, but I use these skills with every webpage.
